title: slh-dsa: bump `zerocopy` to v0.8
body:
The `AsBytes` trait is gone, and now found on the `IntoBytes` trait.

It needs a new `Immutable` marker trait which says:

> Types which are free from interior mutability.

...so it seems safe to add to the types that previously used `AsBytes` which are simple data structs.

title: fix: add SignatureEncoding for ed448::Signature
body:
```
the trait bound `ed448_goldilocks::Signature: SignatureEncoding` is not satisfied
the following other types implement trait `SignatureEncoding`:
  Ed448Signature
  SignatureWithOid<C>
  ecdsa::Signature<C>
  ecdsa::der::Signature<C>
  ed25519_dalek::Signature
  rsa::pkcs1v15::Signature
  rsa::pss::Signature
```

title: dsa: add `from_components_unchecked` APIs
body:
This intends to add support for any size of keys, either larger or older/weak keys.

The API is only available under the `hazmat` feature-flag, and the consumer is responsible for checking the security of what they're using it for.

Fixes #1058

cc @dignifiedquire @hko-s

title: ed*: boilerplate fixups
body:
- README.md: add "signatures" to headline
- Tune up docs.rs configs

title: ml-dsa: Rename `KeyGen::key_gen_internal` to `from_seed`
body:
This is an alternative to #1046 to reduce copying the seed derivation logic. Implementing a `from_seed` as raised in issue #1045.

- Renames `KeyGen::key_gen_internal` to `KeyGen::from_seed`.
- Adds `SigningKey::from_seed`. This internally calls `KeyGen::from_seed` for now, as the majority of the computational work is the same for both keys. A future PR could be slightly more efficient by specialising the SigningKey from_seed method by skipping the couple of extra steps performed to also compute a VerifyingKey, but #1046 shows this only nets a 20us / 10% speed up.
- Adds a test to the `from_seed` implementations don't deviate from each other in future, if more efficient implementations are provided.

I am not sure why `key_gen_internal` was commented to be behind a feature flag or private, as I believe deriving from a seed value is a must-have, assuming this implementation correctly matches the spec. I can look through the spec and codebase for test vectors to make sure, if desired?

Cheers!

title: Cut prereleases with `hybrid-array` v0.4 support
body:
Releases the following:
- `dsa` v0.7.0-rc.5
- `ecdsa` v0.17.0-rc.6
- `rfc6979` v0.5.0-rc.1

title: Bump `hybrid-array` to v0.4
body:
Currently getting a test failure(!) in `dsa`, possibly related to `crypto-bigint` changes?

```
---- verify_signature stdout ----

thread 'verify_signature' panicked at dsa/tests/signature.rs:91:5:
assertion failed: verifying_key.verify_digest(Sha256::new().chain_update(MESSAGE),
        &signature).is_ok()
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

---- sign_message stdout ----

thread 'sign_message' panicked at dsa/tests/signature.rs:80:5:
assertion `left == right` failed
  left: Signature { r: NonZero(BoxedUint(0x00000000C6639F3AC90E4AAE648FB30C885F96A0C5E32D09)), s: NonZero(BoxedUint(0x00000000BFF0252CE80AC9281C12395433CA2FEC8A0DAAFF)) }
 right: Signature { r: NonZero(BoxedUint(0x000000004E12277518F640E33ADB806DE798D3A340F59D0F)), s: NonZero(BoxedUint(0x0000000017781EC8535891E03F2D3627366BAC8ED7F9A4CF)) }
```

Edit: confirm this test failure appears when updating `crypto-bigint` alone, going to bisect the changes.

Edit again: bisected to https://github.com/RustCrypto/crypto-bigint/pull/920

title: build(deps): bump actions/download-artifact from 4 to 5

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: github_actions
labels.description: Pull requests that update GitHub Actions code

body:
Bumps [actions/download-artifact](https://github.com/actions/download-artifact) from 4 to 5.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/download-artifact's releases.

v5.0.0

What's Changed

  • Update README.md by @​nebuk89 in actions/download-artifact#407
  • BREAKING fix: inconsistent path behavior for single artifact downloads by ID by @​GrantBirki in actions/download-artifact#416

v5.0.0

🚨 Breaking Change

This release fixes an inconsistency in path behavior for single artifact downloads by ID. If you're downloading single artifacts by ID, the output path may change.

What Changed

Previously, single artifact downloads behaved differently depending on how you specified the artifact:

  • By name: name: my-artifact → extracted to path/ (direct)
  • By ID: artifact-ids: 12345 → extracted to path/my-artifact/ (nested)

Now both methods are consistent:

  • By name: name: my-artifact → extracted to path/ (unchanged)
  • By ID: artifact-ids: 12345 → extracted to path/ (fixed - now direct)

Migration Guide

✅ No Action Needed If:
  • You download artifacts by name
  • You download multiple artifacts by ID
  • You already use merge-multiple: true as a workaround
⚠️ Action Required If:

You download single artifacts by ID and your workflows expect the nested directory structure.

Before v5 (nested structure):

- uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
  with:
    artifact-ids: 12345
    path: dist
# Files were in: dist/my-artifact/

Where my-artifact is the name of the artifact you previously uploaded

To maintain old behavior (if needed):

</tr></table>

... (truncated)

title: feat(ml-dsa): Implement verifying_key method for SigningKey
body: Introduce a utility method to derive a `VerifyingKey` from a `SigningKey`, even when the original seed or precomputed public key is unavailable. This aids in scenarios where private keys are imported from external sources lacking associated public key data.

title: ecdsa: Remove implementations of `PrehashSignature`
body:
As discussed in https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/issues/1917.

I kept the `DigestAlgorithm` trait because it is still used as a bound in some places, but it could be removed. For example:
```rust
impl<C, D> DigestSigner<D, Signature<C>> for SigningKey<C>
where
    C: EcdsaCurve + CurveArithmetic + DigestAlgorithm,
    D: Digest + FixedOutput,
    Scalar<C>: Invert<Output = CtOption<Scalar<C>>>,
    SignatureSize<C>: ArraySize,
{
    fn try_sign_digest(&self, msg_digest: D) -> Result<Signature<C>> {
        self.sign_prehash(&msg_digest.finalize_fixed())
    }
```
Here, `C: DigestAlgorithm` is used, but `DigestSigner` is implemented for any `D`, not for `<C as DigestAlgorithm>::Digest`. Removing this trait bound would thus have no effect.

title: `der` error handling fixups
body: Companion PR to RustCrypto/formats#1889

title: dsa v0.7.0-rc.1
body: Includes `crypto-bigint` v0.7.0-pre.5 upgrade

title: ecdsa: bump `der` to v0.8.0-rc.5
body:
This version notably automatically handles setting up a nested `Reader` for passing to `DecodeValue::decode_value`, eliminating the need to do it manually.

Also cuts an `ecdsa` v0.17.0-rc.3

title: workspace: check for typos in CI
body: Check for typos in the CI rather than have individual PRs to fix them.

title: dsa: handle `NonZero`/`Odd` conversions on `BoxedUint` internally
body:
Makes `BoxedUint` the one unsigned integer type in the public API, converting to `NonZero<BoxedUint>` and `Odd<BoxedUint>` as needed.

This makes the API simpler to use for end-users, with fewer types for them to manage.

Closes #987

title: ecdsa: rename `DigestPrimitive` to `DigestAlgorithm`
body: This name better gets the intent across

title: ed448: drop `-signature` suffix from crate name
body:
Crate name is now just `ed448`, like the Ed448 variant of EdDSA.

The elliptic curve's name is Ed448-Goldilocks (or "edwards448")

title: ml-dsa: Turn off unsused default features so that no_std works
ed448: implement `AssociatedAlgorithmIdentifier` for `Signature`
body: See <https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8410#section-3>

title: ed25519,ed448: remove std features
body: followup to #984

title: Implement `MultipartSigner/Verifier`
body:
Implementation of `MultipartSigner` and `MultipartVerifier` added in https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1880.

The implementation in ML-DSA and SLH-DSA is not ideal. Basically all the relevant functions are public and only take `&[u8]`. So instead of changing public functions, I just moved the implementation of those functions into private functions that take `&[&[u8]]`. Let me know if you want me to solve this in any other way.

title: dsa: remove `std` feature
body: It isn't actually used for anything, and with a hard dependency on `alloc` and `core::error::Error` we can always capture `Box<std::error::Error>` in `signature::Error`.

title: dsa: minor `hazmat` cleanups
body:
- Place attributes after comments
- Ensure `hazmat` features are documented on docs.rs

title: Bump `digest` dependency to v0.11.0-rc.0
body:
Also bumps:
- `elliptic-curve` v0.14.0-rc.2
- `signature` v3.0.0-rc.0

title: Fix  hi-bit description in RecoveryId documentation
body:
There are 4 bits in total, low-bits are (0/1) and hi-bits should be (2/3) but before it was incorrectly written as (3/4).
This PR fixes this description.

Closes #852

title: apply nightly clippy fixes: const `div_ceil` (2025-05-12)
body:
`cargo clippy --all --all-features --fix`
could not fix these.

`usize` added manually.

Looks like a bug in
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/12987

title: all: test: apply cargo clippy fixes
body:
`rustc 1.85.0`

`cargo clippy --all --all-features --tests`

title: ecdsa: der: use impl `EncodeValue`/`DecodeValue` on `SignatureRef`
body:
This way we avoid using internals of `der`:
- `der::SliceWriter`
- `der::SliceReader`
- `tag.assert_eq`
- `writer.sequence`

title: chore(deps): bump `crypto-bigint` to `0.7.0-pre.3`, use core naming conventions
body:
See:
 - https://github.com/RustCrypto/crypto-bigint/pull/817
Depends:
 - https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1845

title: bump signature git pin
body:
This removes the `derive` feature from `signature`:
 - https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1843

title: ecdsa: restore `RandomizedSigner<der::Signature>`
body: I *think* this was missed in in #955 as this came in #947 which I did not revert.

title: Fix docs.rs SLH-DSA link in README
body: The docs.rs link for SLH-DSA in the roots README was accidentally linking to `ed25519`.

title: refactor: improve no_std support for slh-dsa
body:
correct following configuration from:
```rs
#![cfg_attr(not(feature = "alloc"), no_std)]
```
to
```rs
#![no_std]
```

title: Revert "ecdsa: use blanket impl from `signature` 3 (#945)"
body: This reverts commit 8e6bb26c26ed511fda6e792a12df9c43f07370e9.

title: Implement `Zeroize` for `ed25519::Signature`
body:
This PR implements `Zeroize` for `ed25519::Signature`.

There are no invariants to uphold on this type because it can be constructed from any given bytes.

title: Automatically retry signing with random `k`
body:
This PR changes all signing operations that generate a random `k` to retry with a new random `k` on failure instead of returning an error. This follows [FIPS 186](https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/FIPS/NIST.FIPS.186-5.pdf):
> 11. If r = 0 or if s = 0, and k was generated deterministically (using the procedure in 6.3.2),
then output failure. Otherwise, if r = 0 or if s = 0, then go to Step 3.

Resolves #950.

title: Implement `Zeroize` for `ecdsa::Signature`
body: This PR implements `Zeroize` for `ecdsa::Signature` by setting both scalars to one, which is still a valid signature and upholds the types invariants.

title: ecdsa: restore `Signer<der::Signature>`
body: fix ups to https://github.com/RustCrypto/signatures/pull/945

title: signature does not carry the `std` feature anymore
body: follow up to #945

title: ecdsa: use blanket impl from `signature` 3
body:
This is stacked on #944 

This makes use of https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1827

title: bump ff and group to pre-releases
body:
follow-up to:
  - https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1821
  - https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1822

title: feat(slh-dsa): add zeroize support for SigningKey
body: Closes #937

title: Revert "downgrade ml-dsa and slh-dsa to non-prerelease deps"
body:
This reverts commit 64b55c6393736de5a89b9b4c64f013d680945eef from #931

This was done to kick out some releases, which have now been published, so these crates are going back to using the latest development releases.

title: slh-dsa v0.0.3
body: Backport release with a looser `signature` v2 dependency

title: ml-dsa v0.0.4
body: Initial release

title: ml-dsa: cargo test with --no-default-features in workflow
body:
The CI workflow should build/test with --no-default-features to catch any issues with that configuration.

There is currently 1 warning when building ml-dsa with --no-default-features, and 1 failing doc-test. I'll fix those in upcoming commits, but I first want to run this though the CI to make sure it fails as expected.
